entry.title: Combined summary - Warning message when running wallet in Windows XP (or drop support?)
entry.summary: The discussion revolves around the security concerns of using Windows XP for Bitcoin Core. Mark Friedenbach states that Bitcoin Core will never have an auto-update functionality, as it would be a single point of failure, leading to the theft of all bitcoins in a wallet or causing a hard forking bug. The suggestion is made to make Bitcoin Core detect when running on Windows XP and warn the user of the risks involved. It is revealed that Microsoft has ended support for Windows XP, making it unsafe for online banking and not secure enough for running a wallet. The proposed solution is to eventually offer multi-wallet support that requires users to create a wallet with options like using a hardware security module (HSM) or multisig secured wallet. This would allow Bitcoin Core to whine at users who elect to run an ordinary unsecured wallet on an insecure host and direct them to a security best practices page.
